website_summaries.verdict: A rugged little electric tiller with a bit more width to the blade span and somewhat less power than similar models by Sun Joe.
pros: Has an 18-inch blade span and can cut 7 inches deep, making it suitable for most small to midsize areas
Blades break up most types of soil, even if it takes a little extra attention
Handle can be folded when not in use
cons: Blades tend to get bogged down with heavy grass and weeds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tiller.
customer_reviews.text: This tiller rocks. It's surprisingly light and powerful, cut right through hard Virginia red clay. Was able to till my whole garden in less than 2 hours. You definitely have to be very aware of where the power cable is at all times. It can jump and kick some since it's so light, but as long as you pay attention it's pretty safe. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chilblain

customer_reviews.title: Confusing manual and support
customer_reviews.text: The machine was easy to put together until I got to the wheel instruction. The tilling wheel instruction showed the wheels in two different directions and very little help. Tried FAQs on the website but they didn't work. Tried chat but didn't get an answer. Called but couldn't get an answer from the associate. Finally someone got back on the chat that had an answer. Checked videos on line and none had the wheels as shown or suggested even the promotional video. I guess I will just use it the best way that it works. Also had comments on how light it is and found that it will not dig in without some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Reader

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a few projects
customer_reviews.text: One day the motor was running and it no longer moved. It worked for a few projects and then it did not. I have heavy grass( weeds?). I have a small yard that I was trying to smooth the ruts. I used tiller to dig out this horrible grass (not sure if it is really grass). I used tiller after the ground was soaked from rain. The grass is a crawling grass, not sure what this green vine/plant is. Convenient to own a tiller rather than rent one.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi

customer_reviews.title: Too light weight
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of power for an electric tool and is perfect for small jobs and for cultivating and mixing loose soil. However, it's way too lightweight to handle tilling through compacted soil and it definitely cannot til through sod. Even with the jobs it can handle it's so light weight that its hard to control and it hops around. We have contemplated finding a way to strap some weight on the top of it which would dramatically improve the functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Buckowing

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was reasonably easy, but the handles were poorly designed and did not fit together well. The tiller worked well on a medium sized area...I worked the area twice in short time. Tine speed was fast for cultivating, but the lightweight allowed the tiller to bounce. Overall I was pleased and would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: trying to find more projects
customer_reviews.text: this has more power than the smaller version...I have lots of rocks like I was growing them as potatoes ,roots and hard clay like soil. if you don't push the machine you should do fine....I'm saying this as a start for a new garden (breaking ground)....another area was English ivy ,I cut back to the ground using a gas trimmer then went at it with the rotortilla ,stopping at times just to remove roots wrapped around the tiller....besides that it was easy going and now is a flower bed. it breaks down easily for storage and the weight of it is easy to handle.. I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: ditzygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had a garden before, never mind own a cultivator/tiller. So it took me a minute to get the hang of it and realize how to use it. Once I did, this machine worked great. Duh right down into my hard packed earth with no problem. Didnt strain or struggle once. I am very happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Designed to BREAK.
customer_reviews.text: Breaks after every 5 uses, like clockwork. Specifically, the drive gear wears out, because its made of cheap, soft brass. Company refuses to sell only the gear, which they used to do for $15. Now, you have to buy the entire drive assembly for $45. So, you will pay a tax of about $22 per year to use thing thing, even if you use it just a couple times per year. Looks like the company DELIBERATELY designed the product to fail regularly, so they can sell replacement parts. Seriously, F this company. Im never buying another product from them.
customer_reviews.author: DDDS

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller for small gardens
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions leave something to be desired, even with the supplement. Powerful motor (use a heavy gauge cord for long distances) really does the job. The depth gauge (flip the wheels over) does a great job of holding the tiller back until it has tilled down into the soil. Good, solid tines and the outside two can be removed to till about 12" wide instead of 18"; that will be great in the summer to break up the walking paths in the gardens. On my first use I managed to find the main cable feed to the house and wrap it 3 times around the shaft of the tines. It barely slowed the motor down!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! I bought this to till up some ground for grass seed in September, my dogs destroy my back yard every year. I was planning on just doing a small area. However, when i started moving this thing was unbelievable!!! So easy!!! I ended up tilling up 3/4 of my backyard in a couple of nights after work, hardly any effort at all. I live in CT next to a town named "Rocky Hill" just to give you an idea of what my soil is like, hard and rocky. This thing worked great, I would recommend attacking after some rain, made it that much more easy. So surprisingly light and powerful!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Code Monkey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and used it once on an area about 10 by 12. Has good power, is easy to use, light enough to move around easily. It did a good job cutting through tough grass and fairly hard packed Georgia dirt (another word for clay and rock- if you know what I mean). My only complaint is with the assembly instructions. They are missing a step or two and not particularly easy to follow. Fortunately it was not hard to figure out on my own and there are only a few pieces to put together. All together it took maybe 15 minutes to get it up and running so I wouldn't let this issue keep you from buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gulker

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight! Absolutely terrible it is almost a safety hazard if you didn't have to keep praying the power button it would take off on you. I would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ATiller the Sun
customer_reviews.text: Received the shipment quickly as Amazon has a warehouse close. The Sun Joe Tiller is easy to assemble, took perhaps 15 minutes. Have only had a chance to use it once, on ground that had previously been worked last year. Tiller Joe blazed through it with no problems. easily going to max depth. My only concern at this time is the handles seem a bit flimsy for this type of unit, where in use, you could put some real leverage on them, particularly if tilling unworked ground. They are not sturdy and do flex and wobble when turning or lifting the unit. Time will tell it they hold up. The motor and tines seem powerful enough for the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: rikb

customer_reviews.title: takes like 5 passes to get below the grass level but ...
customer_reviews.text: Its been a year since I bought this tiller. I flattened a 40' by 50' section of yard with it. It did very well. takes like 5 passes to get below the grass level but it nicely. It rained a lot last spring also. In previously tilled ground it does very well. I am impressed. I asked a lot of it and its still in good working order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for light to moderate projects
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after much soul searching about gas vs. electric. Finally decided to take a flyer on electric. This product won't do deep tilling or break up really hard soil due to its light weight, but should be fine for most projects. I'm doing light to moderate work around my home (establishing new planting areas), and it does great. If you're in a similar situation, I recommend you to give this product serious consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Edwards

customer_reviews.title: great power!
customer_reviews.text: After using a beaver (press down, twist, up) and get hurt my back, I decide to buy this tiller. It took me almost nothing to end a ten by ten surface, You know that You love when You start thinking where to use it again. It has great power, You control the speed, but At max You must be pulling, great with a inch stones, with something bigger than 3 inches You must get into. The width is not much small to do more lines to cover a surface, and not much bigger to do small places. Staying enough time it pulverize the soil, remember to keep with the air, cause the dust! and against the electrical conecction.
customer_reviews.author: oscar hdz

customer_reviews.title: It does the job on the cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little machine! I used this to till in my yard so I could smooth out uneven terrain and try to re-establish my lawn. It worked well, tilling soil to a fine powder that was easy to work with. Cons- lightweight makes it slower to dig deep and allows machine to jump around on really hard soil or when hitting rocks, the handles are very uncomfortable to hold- should be curved or maybe shorter?, a simple on/off switch would be nicer than trying to hold the trigger on.
customer_reviews.author: kemuel clayman

customer_reviews.title: The motor is powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is easy. The machine does a very good job of breaking up the hard soil. If you are not careful the machine can jump off in an unexpected way, so don’t rush it.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: I've had a gas tiller which constantly needed attention. I wanted a smaller one to work on specific parts of my garden and yard. The Sun Joe has worked extremely well--for me. I love the fact that it's "light." It's easy to start, easy to maneuver, easy to run, easy to store. It's not as powerful as my gas, but it's exactly what I wanted. Now, I've only had it a few months, and I don't know how it will serve me long term, but I expect it to do well.
customer_reviews.author: ssteachers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My location is extremely rocky with boulders too & after a couple of weeks the tines broke the welds on the right side after daily use, but welded up no problem. I am amazed at this workhorse and what it can do. It really take a lot of abuse and keeps on working. Used it to dig, loosen and level ground for a 14x22 foot patio concrete pavers. In some places I had to dig down 8 inches. Now I will use it for gardening & the easy life it will now have; it really deserves it! Should last for years, imho.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a smallish vegetable garden (about 25 x 16) and this is just the ticket. My Sun Joe starts every time, plows through roots and small stones with ease. I like that it is electric so there is no mixing fuels, no stink and no gas to buy. If electric goes out I can use my generator and still do my tilling. It sure beats shoveling!! Did I mention it is light weight and very easy to carry and store? It can even be hung in the shed to not take up floor space. It was also very easy to put together after it arrived with fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: sunfire

customer_reviews.title: Great little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Have used the Sun Joe TJ601E now for about three months. Tilled my entire yard in sections in some very dry and hard Arizona soil and it works like a champ! I was concerned but the unit plowed through all areas without a hitch -- moves right along and never seems to struggle. It is so much better than a gas powered unit that would require lots more maintenance and upkeep when storing for long periods. One of the best tools I have purchased online through Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Smitten

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tiller!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the power and performance of the Sun Joe TJ601E. I have a 9,000 square foot garden, and use the tiller to till between the rows to plow under the weeds. The 18" tilling width makes the job go quickly. It really does spit out rocks, too. Plus there are no gas fumes or gas motor to start or maintain or buy fuel for. Who doesn't love that? I use a 100 foot 12 gauge extension cord plus a 14 gauge 100 foot cord and there is no drop in performance. I am so glad and impressed with the Sun Joe TJ601E. I am a 64 year old woman, and have no problem handling it.
customer_reviews.author: tril

customer_reviews.title: Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Recived fast was as advertise, has some power just used it after an all night ran in soil That has clay and it never boged down. 4 stars because 1 the quick set up sheet and the manual said different way to put together. 2 some of the pre assembly parts were put together. Wrong. Not done testing yet so will have a fallow up. One note to keep wet soil off and make it harder for weeds or grass to stick, Spray the tillers heavy with pam or and cooking spray really.
customer_reviews.author: readyk

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Never finished the first job. I tilled an area about 10 feet by 10 feet. It overheats about every 2 minutes and I would wait for it to cool. After probably 30 total minutes of working, spread over 3 days, today it died. The motor runs but the tines don't turn. This is my second electric rototiller. My first one was a small model, not designed for big jobs. This one was a stronger motor and wider tilling area, and more money. Completely not worth it. I would not recommend this item to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but as with any other electric tiller it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great but as with any other electric tiller it is a lot lighter than a gas one so you do need to push up on the handles while holding it in place in order to get deeper into the soil.
customer_reviews.author: JSbuyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Ryobe Tiller that had seen better days. Rather than get it fixed for more than it was worth I decided to buy the Sun Joe. Wow! was I glad I did. It works so much better than my old tiler. It plows wider and deeper and is more powerfull. It made short work of tilling my garden this morning and I was thrilled not to be sucking those nasty Oil/Gas fumes that used to give me heart burn and make me choke, when I should have been enjoying the fresh air as I did today. I love this thing. I'll never go back to gas.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Bought for backyard garden.
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. It is easy to use and works like a charm. Being a semi-small lady I had no problems using this, and actually enjoyed the process. My yard is on a slope and the sunjoe made it relatively easy to till. The only thing I can fuss about (not complain) is the extension cord but with practice I got a routine down and had no more problems. I love not having to use gas or having spark plugs to fool with. Especially with gas prices continuing to rise.
customer_reviews.author: carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great for established garden
customer_reviews.text: Good little tiller for garden or flower beds that have established dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Prudhomme

customer_reviews.title: The tires in back didn’t work as listed in the instructions. Had to adjust them on my own, my way.
customer_reviews.text: After a while the handles came little lose. But other than that it was a good machine. Did the job it needed to do. Worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: It wasn’t easy for me to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It takes me a few hours to assemble this tiller but it works fine, thanks
customer_reviews.author: RAMON CACERES

customer_reviews.title: Tiller analogy
customer_reviews.text: 1. Packaging needs improving, The first tiller we received the carrying handle was broken and the wheels were bent at an angle. 2. The company was very easy to work with for a replacement tiller. 3. The plastic handles are quite flimsy at the point where they are secured to metal tube by a screw, as the threads strip out. 4. I was disapointed that that they did not include a few instructions on how to actually use the tiller, as I had never used one before. 5. We have only used it for about 20 minn. trying to figure out how it works and it did seem to work ok.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty12

customer_reviews.title: Its Okay
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this tiller for about 3 weeks now. I have really really hard clay soil. This tiller did okay. I had to use my broadfork to tear into the soil and break it. Then I would use the tiller to break up the soil. It makes the job easier...at first I was only the broadfork and shovel to break up the soil. With the tiller it does make the job go by faster. Other than that......If it wasn't for the broadfork, I would be in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Wonna Pulling

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I don't have to worry about gas and oil ...
customer_reviews.text: It got here on time. It works very well for my needs event though it is electric. I'm glad I don't have to worry about gas and oil and hard starting. I used it to till the entire back yard since it was basically dirt and weeds when we moved in. Now my wife is planting veggies, etc. Very happy with this purchase. i will use it many times over the coming years.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Spurgin

customer_reviews.title: this thing is great
customer_reviews.text: At first i thought i made a mistake when i ordered this tiller...the first one i had to send back because of a broken axel but amazon was great..they had ups pick up the old one and delivered a new one two days later...my grandson put it together and i tryed it out..couldnt belive this thing has so much power..i tilled one area of my garden in just a few minutes..it was so easy i did it several times..like i said this thing is great.....
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: This tiller joe is amazing! plenty of power to till
customer_reviews.text: This tiller joe is amazing! plenty of power to till. I like the ease of use and the ability to till without getting stuck with some rocks. I tilled my whole backyard to level it and plant new grass and it didn't overheat for the 5hr use to get the job done. I highly recommend this product and I will buy it again if I need another one.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for Small Garden Spaces
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this once or twice since I've had it, but I really do like it. I didn't expect it to do a lot of deep tilling, so it is perfect for my garden space. I live in Georgia and we have a lot of red clay, it worked fine for the regular areas but I wouldn't try it on the packed clay areas.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Cleo Pup

customer_reviews.title: Good light duty tiller, terrible packaging.
customer_reviews.text: It is and does what you'd expect of it. Decent tiller with enough power for light garden work. Not fancy, but it's quiet, easy to use, light, and starts up when you need it. Assembly was very easy. Only downside was that the packaging was terrible. Small assembly parts were loose and I was missing a screw which likely worked it's way out of the box. There was no indication that this was not a new product which is why I was surprised it was packaged so poorly.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Wow! It really works!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tiller with some trepidation, but decided it was worth a try before I went out and purchased a heavy, expensive tiller that would "really do the work". Well... I was shocked and amazed how well this tiller dug up the Alabama clay. It tilled a 50x50 area in record time. I will say this though, there were two of us working in tandem; one was operating the tiller and the other was feeding the cord and making sure the cord stayed out of the way of the tiller; once we got our movements orchestrated it went very well.
customer_reviews.author: HollyM

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent light weight tiller for small to medium garden plots. Bounces around some but spit out small to medium stones. When mine arrived it was missing the upper frame but a quick e-mail to the manufacture was promptly answered and I had the upper frame in a week or so. If you are not particularly strong or have back problems as I do this might be your answer. No messing with gas and oil and once you figure out how too handle your extension cord you can zoom right along.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing how quickly this tiller will work thru even the ...
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how quickly this tiller will work thru even the hardest soil. Removed a 12" top layer from 3000 sqr ft of my yard with no problems. Alot of gravel and some clay but nothing seemed to slow this thing down. I bought this instead of a full size gas tiller because it's light enough to hang in my shed, has no maintenance, and is much more ecological.
customer_reviews.author: NorthWind

customer_reviews.title: Very good tiller.
customer_reviews.text: Very good tiller,I had a problem with it but Sun Joe replaced it with no problems.Save your back and buy this tiller,it's powerful enough to get most projects done and it actually spits the rocks out from the soil,just be sure not to force the tool,that way your tool will work like it was designed to and you'll also avoid personal injury.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Echevarria

customer_reviews.title: What a little beast!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tiller! Keeps on plowing through. I used it to tear up my entire lawn, which was lots of rocks and weeds and grass. Ate it up like it was no problem! Powerful and easy, makes it easy to take a quick break without having to turn an engine off and on. Just use a cord reel. Love it! Would recommend with pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Salt

customer_reviews.title: Tiller Headlines!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was highly skeptical of an electric tiller versus a gas tiller, power wise. This is the BEST tiller I have ever used. Digs 6" deep in hard clay soil. "No better test". It's light and easy to hold while tilling. ""I'm a total believer in this tiller for a DIY homeowner garden"" Very well priced. I highly recommend to everyone!!
customer_reviews.author: 41Buick

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. Did a large front yard full of pretty bad weeds if you can call them weeds. Not sure what some of those fiber plants were but it took them down. Yes you will have to stop and remove them from the cutters once in a while but when you do things cheap then be ready to do the extra work.
customer_reviews.author: Throver

customer_reviews.title: Works great. This was my first time using a tiller ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This was my first time using a tiller (ok I haven't even used something as basic as a lawn mower), and it is definitely user friendly and does not require too much muscle. I've had to go over 2-3 times to get my grass out. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Aurial

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought it sooner.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I bought this sooner. I bought it based on other reviews. I have a 27'x13' garden that I normally till by hand. Since the birth of my daughter, I don't have the time. It's lightweight, easy to use, and much more powerful than I expected. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Guerra

customer_reviews.title: its electric
customer_reviews.text: Nice light little Taylor works okay but it kind of beat you to death in always trying to pull away really doesn't have a very good spike to hold it in place And this was used in good top soil did work on 14 gauge hundred foot extension cord which I was happy about that
customer_reviews.author: PaPa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe tiller is a winner
customer_reviews.text: This small tiller is ideal for my small raised bed garden plots. It has plenty of power and is able to till well beyond the 7" depth listed in the specs. Why did I buy it? Two primary reasons: 1. Its electric... no gas, no emissions, no hard starting. 2. Its inexpensive.... less than half the price of a competitive gas model.
customer_reviews.author: A. T. Nader

customer_reviews.title: Best tiller I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: After giving up on more than one gas- powered tiller, bought this electric thru Amazon. Easy to assemble the handle, immediately went to work on tough Colorado clay... And much to my surprise, this little tiller can even carve up cement-like clay. Take the wheels off for deeper digging. We've used it many many hours... No issues. No special storage, no old gas to dispose of next spring, so when it's time to start another project, plug in and go to work. No anger management issues trying to start a gas unit ever again... That's worth the $$ right there.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Redwood

customer_reviews.title: Energizer bunny of tillers
customer_reviews.text: Had this for four years now. Very reliable, never fails for spring plow/till, and fall till/disc.
customer_reviews.author: Ida Gray

customer_reviews.title: Real Work Horse
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller is really amazing for its size, it has lots of pI would recommend this little guy.
customer_reviews.author: Big swede

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very very good. Works hard and 8 foot by 10foot space done great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other
customer_reviews.text: I love this tiller. It does exactly what I need it to do. I've had gas powered and another electric one -- this one is better than any other. It's perfect for me. I have used it largely to manage my extensive beds. It's more than paid for itself already, and it's only April! It has inspired me to expand my vegetable garden since I now have a worthy helping hand -- Sun Joe.
customer_reviews.author: Sarita

customer_reviews.title: I love the tiller but it is a little bigger than ...
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot of problems starting the gas tiller and I bought this one so I could use it anytime I needed it. I love the tiller but it is a little bigger than I had hoped for. I little too wide. I am impressed with the way it cuts into the Kentucky clay we have.
customer_reviews.author: triple47

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: After buying a different electric cultivator from another manufacturer, which was only a half an amp weaker and was pure garbage, I wasn't sure I had a lot of hope for this. WOW was I surprised. It ripped right through the dirt, weeds and grass and I was able to clear out my garden pretty easily. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dawne766

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Nice job Joe's! I had finally had it with my gas "tiller" and tired of it overheating and jamming on rocks so I figured how bad could the Sun Joe be for that awesome price? Well it has as much power easily as the gas tiller, no jams, never overheated or stopped and dug like a gopher on crack. The usual afternoon afair of cursing at the old tiller became 30 minutes of easy peasy for our 20'x40' garden. Thanks Sun Joe!!
customer_reviews.author: shrednar

customer_reviews.title: better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Being relatively cheap I didn't have high expectations but I couldn't be happier with it. I've started replacing my gas powered lawn equipment with electrical equivalents because they're maintenance free. I bought it to dig up parts of my lawn to replace 6-8" of topsoil (mostly builders sand and stones!). I tackled about 200sf. Will do more next year. It had no trouble with the stones (up to 4"). If the stone was too big to budge, it would just bounce off it, with no damage done. It's seem very sturdy and doesn't take up much room hanging in my shed. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nezza

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tiller to tackle a pretty large area that was full of grass and weeds, so that I could plant shrubs and perennials to make a new flower bed. I chose the Sun Joe based largely on the reviews already posted and I was not disappointed. My soil is clay and impacted but it cut through everything easily and turned it into light, sifted soil! I am a woman in her sixties and found the tiller easy to manage and direct, although tackling the area in patches was easier than doing a large area at once. I would definitely recommend the Sun Joe to anyone contemplating a home garden project.
customer_reviews.author: Gd48

customer_reviews.title: super light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: super light and easy to use, after I was done using it for my garden I have brought it to my parents that are almost 70 so they can use it to keep the weeds out of theirs without having to mess with their heavy big tiller and gas
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for ginormas plots. Great for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it to till a flower bed and garden plot. This thing is a bit of a beast. With the wheels on it was a little limited. I took the wheels off and then this thing really showed me what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: M.Case

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase a must have for all gardeners
customer_reviews.text: tilled entire section 8n under 20 mins amazing great power.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Izquierdo

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Pretty tough. Gets clogged with weeds and have to stop to clean out
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H.

customer_reviews.title: Tough Little Digger
customer_reviews.text: I got this little fella to break up some areas in my yard for reseeding. It rips out the old crabgrass and breaks up the topsoil to get it ready for new grass seed. It does what I need and it handles pretty good. Lightweight but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this tiller for a small project in our backyard. It worked far better than we expected and went through the grass and dirt without any bogging down. The electric cord is a little bit of a nuisance however we knew that when we bought it. We figured out a way to make that easier and it worked fine. We are thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: review from cleve

customer_reviews.title: A real mighty-might!
customer_reviews.text: This is a real mighty-might. Tired of hand turning the 250 sq ft garden, I bought this tiller. Finished the job in an hour. Plenty of power to dig down to at least 7 inches. Very sturdy, and very quiet. Easy enough I can let my 14 year old do the job from now on. Priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Ground_water

customer_reviews.title: this works so nice..
customer_reviews.text: this works so nice...i think the pin is too short to keep removing and putting back in..i took off wheels when i get out to garden and when i put them back into the machine..i use a long nail..works for me..
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Has the power to till a good sized garden. Comfortable to use and easy to roll on ground. Happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Happy vessey

customer_reviews.title: Also, very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: No hassle of starting up like the gas powered machines. Plenty of power to till a flower bed and make it look like a professional job.
customer_reviews.author: BICK QUINBY

customer_reviews.title: Except of the instructions this tiller is worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this buy! Came in a box and had to build it together. I would have given 5 stars, but the instructions were really bad. Had to figure out myself.....really? After this issue I had my 24x24 garden tilled in about 1 1/2 hours, what was awesome! Even my wife was able to use it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Rodesheim

customer_reviews.title: This unit is powerful. Did my entire back yard ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is powerful. Did my entire back yard in under 5 hours. My backyard is around 3500 sq. Ft. And this unit handled it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Grinceri

customer_reviews.title: Handy yard tool
customer_reviews.text: It worked wonders. It is not heavy, but it does have a bite to it. It turned over grass, small rocks (smaller than a softball). Come spring time I am going to turn it lose, and start my garden
customer_reviews.author: paulk

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller so far
customer_reviews.text: Great tiller... I bought it to till a 30ft x 30ft area... Man this thing is a beast.. Tore thru the dirt faster then any gas powered tiller. Made it thru one season no issues
customer_reviews.author: Monk

customer_reviews.title: Man what a great product. It does have a little problem with ...
customer_reviews.text: Man what a great product. It does have a little problem with roots that are bunched all together, but other than that it is very powerful and efficient at tilling up the ground
customer_reviews.author: gtg

customer_reviews.title: some parts could be better built but it was a good price
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this one time. It worked just as I thought it would. some parts could be better built but it was a good price. if you are not going to do a lot of tilling this will be a good. if you are planning on a large garden get a gas model.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: works well but...
customer_reviews.text: This one works well as it's supposed to. The only thing I don't like about it is the wheels. They seem not lasting long because they are made of thin plastic so I put the tiller on a wheelbarrow and carry it to the place I want to work. The wheels also intervene with my digging holes for planting. I prefer the smaller model which has no wheels.
customer_reviews.author: lovenature

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: More power than I expected. It ripped through the hard ground. Had to go over again, but it did a great job for a little tiller.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sissom

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This tiller works great i didn't expect much from it but i am very happy .It is very powerful it even chewed up grass after a going over it a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Jmini

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have for small to medium lawns, love that it does not require any maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast
customer_reviews.text: We Actually nicknamed this Tiller The beast. It really rips up the ground. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Lyndon Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Bad boy tiller forget that its electric
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done and breathe cleaner while you use this awesome tiller.Didn;t see ANYTHING close to this size at local home & garden stores and those are all gas booooooo to mass retailers.Thanks Sun Joe!!!! Your tiller rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brown

customer_reviews.title: NICE SMALL GARDEN SIZED TILLER
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A GREAT TILLER FOR SMALL GARDENS. THERE IS PLENTY POWER TO TILL THE SOIL AND MIX MULCH OR OTHER NUTRIENTS INTO THE SOIL. I USED THE TILLER AND WAS PLEASED WITH THE FINE TEXTURE OF THE SOIL WHEN I WAS PLANTING THE SEED. I LET MY NEIGHBOR USE THE TILLER HE AND HIS WIFE BOTH USED THE TILLER AND WAS WELL PLEASED WITH THE RESULTS. I WOULD NOT HESITATE RECOMENDING THIS TILLER, HIGHLY RECOMENDED FOR HOME GARDENS
customer_reviews.author: HAPPY

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe TJ601E Tiller Joe 9-Amp Electric...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully easy to use and to hold onto. Have used it many times over the past month, and have only good experiences with it.
customer_reviews.author: Constance H. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Started it and the start push button broke
customer_reviews.text: The start button uses a cheap plastic pin and can break easily. I may have a defective start push button. The 1866-766-9563 to Sun Joe customer service has no live customer service. Only a voice mail. Keep away from this low quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil M. Pais

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little garden tool. Surprised me when I started it up. Usually electric gadgets don't do well, but this little item digs so hard it will bury itself if you let it.
customer_reviews.author: poodle

customer_reviews.title: when it did run it did a good job, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: used it on broken ground, worked for about 10 minutes then quit. would not run again. when it did run it did a good job, very disappointed.....
customer_reviews.author: donald dohrn

customer_reviews.title: It was pretty good, did the job
customer_reviews.text: I used this to dig up the grass and weeds in my yard so I could replant. It was pretty good, did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Katchan22

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Works great for an electric machine.I have been using on large areas which I was concerned it could nt handle it but it has worked great!Very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleasantly surprised at the quality and ease of use of the tiller. It performed better than I expected and is well worth the price. Will consider Sun Joe products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Russell W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Mini hulk is amazing for the price....................
customer_reviews.text: Honestly was not expecting much for the price but boy did this mini hulk pay for it self 1000%. I am relandscaping 1 acre on my 3 acres & I had to till wild grass to put in new landscaping well this little electric tiller beats gas powered tillers costing much more. Easy start no hassles with pull cords or chokes or smelly gasoline & it is very light but the tines tore up the wild grass down to the roots. Very eat to clean & what it costs to rent a low level gas tiller you can have the mini hulk for life.
customer_reviews.author: John  S

customer_reviews.title: I used this Sun Joe 9-Amp Tiller on our little ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this Sun Joe 9-Amp Tiller on our little Garden and it Performed flawlessly. I can say I put it to the test and it was a Little Beast.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: A garden maker
customer_reviews.text: This is just the ticket for a small garden. ours is about 20 feet by 30 feet and the best part is......the wife can use it just fine....no honey do list here it is light yet powerful and she did it all by herself!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Quite surprising actually. Although it does not run real deep into the soil, it does a very good job pounding the dirt. My garden is not real big, probably 250 square feet. I had it done in like 15 minutes. If I had any real cons about it, it would be keeping the electrical cord out of the way or it coming undone from the plug in on tiller. Overall, I am very happy with it though.
customer_reviews.author: David Eicher

customer_reviews.title: Tine is inoperable
customer_reviews.text: A tine gt bound and is not inoperable. Can you fix it>
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Brannan P.O. 391, 118 W. Mickinley, Masison , ks.66860

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Worked great im my raised garden beds. Acually was more powerful than i expected, the cord is a little cumbersome but that is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: charles eric starkey

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: So far this little machine has done everything that we need it to do in our flower beds. It isn't too heavy and bounces around a bit in harder soil until it gets broken up. Does a great job in softer soil and eventually cuts through most softer roots. I was a bit leary of the plastic shroud and wheels, but they are holding up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Debbyxray

customer_reviews.title: Works excellently on already tilled areas
customer_reviews.text: I don't mean to imply that it won't work well on un-tilled areas - I just haven't tried that yet. I used it to till the top few inches of an area that had been tilled weeks previous by a tractor. It worked great. It had no problem moving sizable rocks out of the way. Afterwards, I constructed 12' x 4' raised beds and filled them with soil and amendments. I used the tiller to mix it up. It does a great job. My guess is that it could handle hard soil pretty well, though it may take some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Klatt

customer_reviews.title: sun joe tiller
customer_reviews.text: this is a very good product. i would recommend this product for its ease of handling. the electric start and size make it easy to use but also gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: dano

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flower beds
customer_reviews.text: Great for tight corners, edges,flower beds , around the house, small and easy to use, doesnt require gas or oil,
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Sun Joe Tiller TJ01E
customer_reviews.text: This item exceeded expectations. it is light weight and works well in the soft soil I have to till. Very easy on my bad back.
customer_reviews.author: Gutfernot

product_meta.title: Sun Joe TJ601E Tiller Joe 9-Amp Electric Garden Tiller/Cultivator
product_meta.description: SUN JOE's TJ601E 9 AMP ELECTRIC TILLER/CULTIVATOR COMBINES THE POWER OF A GAS TILLER WITH THE CONVENIENCE OF AN EASY-TO-USE ELECTRIC TILLER. This electric tiller features six steel-angled blades that instantly and effectively loosen the ground to make planting and dirt removal quick and easy. Compared with labor some hand tools, the TJ601E electric garden tiller significantly reduces the strain on the operator so that tilling your garden is more enjoyable and less stressful. THE TILLER AND CULTIVATOR COMBO FEATURES A POWERFUL MOTOR AND AN ERGONOMIC, USER-FRIENDLY DESIGN. Behind TJ601E's dependable performance is a powerful 9 AMP motor that keeps this electric tiller plowing through even the toughest terrain. The tiller's corded electric design means you do not need to worry about dead batteries, running out of gas, or making the right gas and oil mix. In addition, this garden tiller features an instant start push-button, so you can trust that this tiller will be ready to go whenever you are--no frustrating, arm-wrenching pull starts required. SMART, SAFE AND EASY TO HANDLE. Sun Joe TJ601E electric tiller features a safety switch that prevents accidental start-ups, as well as a pair of oversized, ergonomic handles, to provide maximum user comfort. Find your right height with 7 adjustable wheel positions. The dependable Sun Joe TJ601E is ETL inspected and approved, and is backed by a full two-year .
feature_bullets: Versatile: ideal for Small to medium gardens and flower beds
Powerful: 9-amp motor cultivates up to 18" Wide x 7" Deep
Durable: 6 Steel tilling blades for maximum durability and performance
MAINTENANCE-FREE: No gas, oil or tune-ups make it effortless to start and maintain

We’ve got you covered! : your new Tiller + cultivator is backed by the snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact snow Joe + Sun Joe customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.
